dialogue.String: 1�Oh my Gob! You're one of those adventurerurers, aren't ya?You got nothin' on me, �[man./lady.] I was just mindin' my own businesesess, lookin' for junk an' stuff.
1�Hey, watch out. You don't wanna fight me. I'll turn you into meat jerky!Wait, how about you and me be friends instead? Sound good?
1�I travel all over the world and hear lots of differererent stories. I even hear your stories. I can tell you one, if you want.
1�Do you want to hear a story?No, thank you.Let's hear one.

1�What story would you like to be told?On second thought, maybe later.Green recommendation letter.A Little Knowledge(pt.1).A Little Knowledge(pt.2).A Little Knowledge(pt.3).A Little Knowledge(pt.4).The Weekly Adventurer(pt.1).The Weekly Adventurer(pt.2).The Weekly Adventurer(pt.3).The Weekly Adventurer(pt.4).
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Well, looky here! Couldn't say no to adventure, could you? That's why you're here, right? Right?
1�Is it?Show me the way!I've enough adventure, thank you.
1�Hey! Hey!Who let you in here? Nobody's supposed to know about the Federation's secret base--��nobody�� meaning you, not me, you see?
1�O�`h! An adventurer! Why didn't you say so?An adventurer! One who adventures! One who seeks adventure! Well, adventurer, is it adventure that you seek?
1�Is it?Show me the way!I've enough adventure, thank you.
1�An adventurer with enough adventure!? Where is the adventure in that!? And you call yourself an adventurer!

1�I knew it! From the moment you said you were an adventurer, I could sense something...adventurous about you, my friend. And what could be more adventurous than joining an organization called the ��Cobras��?
1�Wait right here. I have something for you.
1�Alright, show this to Lieutenant Miah Riyuh in Windurst.
1�What is it? Why, a recommendation letter from yours truly! How else would you get into the Cobras?
1�Come on, take it. Don't be sh
y.�There you go. And now all you have left to do is sneak past all the beastmen guarding the path to the Federation capital. Quite adventuresome, I would say.
1�Good luck, and may the wisdom of the stars light your path!
1�Well, tickle my belly.I don't get too many customers all the way out here in this day and age.
1�Name's Tucker. I'm a trader out of Jeuno. I specialize in providing goods and services for those scholar types.
1�Hm? Scholars?You know, they use them ��grim-wahs�� and study marital...er, martial theory...or some such.
1�Anyway, they're a weird bunch.The most famous one I've heard of is a Bastokan army officer, and he's holed up in a tomb in Batallia Downs somewhere. Crazy, I tell you.
1�So, you're  , right?
1�Hehe, and that's not all I know.A little bird tells me you need %����.
1�Well, okay, it wasn't a little bird. It was Professor Ulbrecht, the loony in the tomb.He said I'd be getting a visit from a  �[lady/guy] called  .
1�And shave my moustache if he wasn't right.Anyway, I might be able to help you with your little task.
1�Of course, it ain't gonna be for free.
1�Here's the deal.I give you one #���� for every twelve %���� you bring me.
1�I'll take up to four dozen at a time.That means four %���� for you.
1�With the way those scholars go through 'em, %���� are a gold mine for traders right now.I'm letting them go for cheap, if you ask me.
1�I'll be right here when you're ready to trade the goods.
1�You brought the %����?Fair enough. Here's my side of the bargain.
1�This should give a nice boost to my profits.Lemme let you in on a trader's secret as a little bonus.
1�Crawler saliva has a preserving effect, you see.The %���� that have been down here for years sell for ridiculous prices.
1�That's why there's always been a market for 'em here in the nest.
1�I came to buy %���� on the way back from business with a customer, but the fields had been ripped up by a scuffle between Federation forces and the turtle guys. The shipments were canceled...
1�I was in a real pickle until you showed up.And now I have pickled %����!
1�I'm still taking %���� if you've got 'em.Just keep rolling those beauties into my arms!
1�Don't forget to show that 3���� to Cobra Lieutenant Miah Riyuh in Windurst.
1�A seasoned adventurer like yourself should have no problem passing the initiation!
1�So, you're one of us now!Ah, victory is nigh! The Shadow Lord trembles on his throne as we speak!
1�And if I keep telling myself that, someday it will come true, no?
1�Good luck, and may the wisdom of the stars light your path!
1�Hm? Scholars?You know, they use them ��grim-wahs�� and study marital...er, martial theory...or some such.
1�Anyway, they're a weird bunch.The most famous one I've heard of is a Bastokan army officer, and he's holed up in a tomb in Batallia Downs somewhere. Crazy, I tell you.
1�Here's the deal.I give you one #���� for every twelve %���� you bring me.
1�I'll take up to four dozen at a time.That means four %���� for you.
1�With the way those scholars go through 'em, %���� are a gold mine for traders right now.I'm letting them go for cheap, if you ask me.

1�With the way those scholars go through 'em, %���� are a gold mine for traders right now.I'm letting them go for cheap, if you ask me.
1�I'm still taking %���� if you've got 'em.Just keep rolling those beauties into my arms!
1�You brought the %����?Fair enough. Here's my side of the bargain.
1�Thank you berry much! Ahaha...
1�I'm still taking %���� if you've got 'em.Just keep rolling those beauties into my arms!
1�Be safe on your travels.And say hello to that nutty professor for me!
1�Well, tickle my belly.I don't get too many customers all the way out here in this day and age.
1�Fruits have an off-season, you know.What do you expect me to do with these?Eat 'em myself?
1�Go play at trading somewhere else.
1�Crawler saliva has a preserving effect, you see.The %���� that have been down here for years sell for ridiculous prices.
1�That's why there's always been a market for 'em here in the nest.
1�What are you doing here? This is no place for civilians.
1�Ahhh, so you're military tactician who who drew up the plans for this latest supply mission.Why don't we ask one of the men how its going, shall we?

1�Greetings. I am 	, Campaign Arbiter for the Allied Forces.
1�What can I help you with?Nothing.Performance assessment.New Allied Tags.Temporary items.Union registration.Teleportation.Information on the Allied Campaign.
1�You've already undergone an evaluation for this battle, or had you forgotten?As much as I'd like to, I'm forbidden from providing you with a new set of Allied Taegs until the next battle begins.

�!�I am sorry,  , but your campaign medal has expired. I cannot issue tags to anyone not authorized by the Allied Forces. Return to your nation's capital and speak with a Campaign Evaluation Official.

1�Understood. Good work today,
1�What would you like to know?Nothing. I'm sorry.About performance assessment.About Allied Tags.About temporary items.About Unions.
1�Anyone wearing Allied Tags while participating in a campaign battle will be judged on their overall performance.
1�Soldiers will be evaluated not only on their fighting skills, but also on how much they contribute to the efforts of their allies through means such as healing and enhancing.
1�However, beware that if you leave the area before being assessed, you will be deemed a deserter and will forfeit all rewards earned that day.
1�Also, while there are no immediate penalties for being knocked out, falling in battle will significantly lower the score given to you.
1�When you are ready to receive compensation for your work on the field, return to me and I shall assess your performance and provide you with your payment.
1�That is all.
1�Allied Tags are a special type of identification given to all participants of Allied Campaign battles.
1�There are benefits, as well as drawbacks, to wearing the tags. One of the benefits is that in the case you are knocked out on the battlefield, you will not lose any experience points.
1�However, some of the drawbacks include the inability to improve skills and earn experience points for individual kills, as well as the right to loot fallen enemies.
1�That is all.
1�Temporary items can be purchased in exchange for Allied Notes.
1�There are several different varieties of items, but they all have one thing in common--they can only be used on the battlefield they were issued.
1�It is highly recommended that you first survey a battle's conditions and then select the supplies that you believe will benefit you most.
1�Please remember that all temporary items you carry on your person will be confiscated in the event that you leave the area.
1�That is all.
1�Oh ho! Keen to join a Union, are we?Very well. Listen up and I shall tell you all you need to know.

1�In order to better coordinate Allied efforts against the beastman menace, we have instituted a system of ad hoc tactical regiments called ��Unions.�� With five units to a battlefield, union registration is open to any proven soldier in possession of Allied Tags.
1�In return for their aid in advancing the war effort, union registrants will be eligible to earn a share of the spoils of war.

1�Needless to say, the choicest rewards will be reserved for those unions which make the greatest contributions in combat.Prove your mettle on the field of battle, and you will earn glory for your union, as well as a sizable bounty of your own.

1�Be forewarned that your commitment to your union comes first and foremost.In the aftermath of battle, you will not be permitted to reap rewards from your individual exploits until your union has distributed its plunder.
1�That is all.
1�Register for a union?No.Yes.
1�What will you do?Nothing.Transfer to another union.Resign union membership.

1�Your steadfast efforts have earned you a claim to share in your union's spoils of war.By  �[transferring to another union/resigning from your union], you will relinquish this right.It is not my place to question your decision, but I suggest you pay the matter due heed.
1� �[Transfer unions/Resign from your current union]?No.Yes.

1� �[Transfer unions/Resign from your current union]?No.Yes.

1�Hey there, kid, I'm Naiko-Paneiko, up-and-coming ace journalist.Journeying to the remotest frontlines of battle to cover all the news that's fit to printaru!
1�I'll travel all over Vana'diel if I have to!To tell people the truth! The real truth about this war that the wartime papers aren't printing!
1�...Oh, what's this? You've got a slight air of journalism about you, kid.Whaddaya say? Wanna help a Taru out?
1�There's just two things a good journalist has gotta have, kid!Impeccable verbiage, and a nose for the truth!And, well...and feet, I suppose...to go story-hunting... Three things!

1�And I sense all of those things in you. Especially the feet!You're practically overflowing with journalistic vibes, kid! A natural-born newshound!And I'm not only saying that because I'm tragically shorthanded, either.
1�In fact, it so happens that I just received a hotaru lead!I was eavesdropping on some sol--I mean...I overheard some soldiers talking the other day. Yeah, that's it!
1�Rumor has it that a peculiar oddity of a monster has appeared in the Rolanberry Fields.
1�Supposedly some soldiers have been dispatched to take care of it.So go track them down and find out exactly whataru is going on, kid!
1�Here ya go. Use this to reportaru back as soon as you hear something.

1�Woohoo, this is what we live for, kid! Can't ya feel it!?Now get a move on! There's no time to lose!A cold story is no story at all!

1�I just don'taru get it. These articles are all based on the finest intelligence gathering.But we can't even sell an issue! And just look at these losses!Get out there and get me some more stories!
1�Rewrite! From the beginning!Go back and get your facts straightaru!Move it!
1�This just doesn't make any sense! Nothing but columns based on solid factaru, and I'm receiving complaint after complaint from readers saying that they're all fabrications and falsehoods!
1�Rewrite! From the beginning!Go back and get your facts straightaru!Move it!
1�We gotta put this in printaru and get it in the paper-wapers, double-time!It's sure to get rave reviews from our readers!

1�Alll rightaru! Let's make the news!
1�I might justaru send you off on another story-hunt, kid.Be ready-weady! A good journalist always is!

1�The young Elvaan wearin' the red hat is a blacksmith.Make sure he's using fire crystals.
1�The adorable little Tarutaru with the blonde braids is laying plaster.Gonna have to get her on some ice crystals.

1�That old coot of an Elvaan with the huge axe strapped across his back is a carpenter.Famous 'round these parts. Make sure you get him workin' with earth crystals.
